title: Manmohan Singh: India's quiet reformer | PIIE
snippet: These policies remained in place for decades and seemed impervious to reform owing to what one economist called a “witch’s brew of stale ideology, vested interests, and fear of the unknown.” · A balance of payments crisis in 1990–91 brought to power a weak government headed by Prime Minister P.
